posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
WhiZard wrote:
XP Penalty: Starting at level 21 though this can be prevented if the XP is gained in a shifted form.


 
I wouldn't recommend this Tenser-like illegal racial exploit.  Depending which class is due to level, you're likely to lose skill points.  The build has an intrinsic -20% XP penalty for 20 levels so just eat it and keep a smile on your (elven) face.

I quite like this build because I feel Stunning Fist has been underappreciated in general so a shifter without monk levels is doubly inventive.

I am assuming the alternative for outsider note was intended to index the undead shape but am asterisk-blind, relying on intuition and clairvoyance in this case.

Assuming there are those out there that actually would like to try this build "as is" and hit the ground running, it would be a courtesy to furnish the skill allotment schedule for those few bold adventurers (I know you pre-built this toon in some trainer module or via the console.  What happened?  Did your pen go dry?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Not specific to this build, Hip, but you say that Stunning Fist is underappreciated...and you're not wrong. I have never had a successful strike with it, and I love Monk (you know what I mean). To be fair, because it had bombed so badly for me, I never really tried it after L14 or so. It may have something to do with my playing PvM/E rather than PvP, but still, it makes me suspect I'm either missing a trick or am stupendously unlucky (heavens forbid that it's just me not doing it right). Any guidance?

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Take a good look at WhiZard's build and tell me what stands out most... far beyond most every build you've seen.

Your answer should have been: Wisdom.

And that is what a stunner needs to be successful.  Between the intrinsic level (WIS 30) plus a casting of Owl's Insight, Whizard's stunner reaches a DC of 63.  If you are able to cap WIS with items, that becomes DC of 66 vs. opposing Fort save. But, of course, you need to choose your targets well.  Crit immunes are stun immunes and high Fort targets like dragon have a very small chance of success.  But the attack penalty is not too bad, only -4.  Understand though, that until your AB reaches a decent level, your attempts will not even connect let alone succeed in stunning.  I am particularly partial to the 3 round paralysis which is usually long enough for a coup de grâce.

High-level casting clerics are ideally suited to be stunners but usually they will wield weapons that can be buffed rather than go unarmed and miss those opportunities.
